law.catch_line: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated....

section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Council" means the Maryland Youth Advisory Council.

"High school student" means a youth who is enrolled in high school, who is a home school student, or who is enrolled in a program that leads to a high school diploma or certificate of attendance or a general equivalency diploma.
"Institution of postsecondary education" has the meaning stated in § 10-101 of the Education Article.
"Public senior higher education institution" has the meaning stated in § 10-101 of the Education Article.
"Youth" means an individual who is 14 to 22 years old.

text.section: There is a Maryland Youth Advisory Council.

The Council consists of:
the following members appointed by the President of the Senate:
six high school students, including at least three who are students in the State and who are enrolled in public high schools;
two youths who are students at institutions of postsecondary education located in the State; and
one member of the Senate;
the following members appointed by the Speaker of the House of Delegates:
six high school students, including at least three who are students in the State and who are enrolled in public high schools;
two youths who are students at institutions of postsecondary education located in the State; and
one member of the House of Delegates;
the following members appointed by the Governor:
twelve youths, including at least ten high school students, at least five of whom shall be students in the State who are enrolled in public high schools; and
four youths who are students at institutions of postsecondary education located in the State;
the following members selected by other youths, including:
fifteen high school students chosen by the Maryland Association of Student Councils; and
eight youths who are students at institutions of postsecondary education located in the State, including:
three members selected by the University System of Maryland Student Council; and
five members selected by the Student Advisory Council to the Maryland Higher Education Commission, including:
an executive board that consists of:
four members selected by the youth members appointed by the President of the Senate and the Speaker of the House, including:
three high school students; and
one student at an institution of postsecondary education;
four members selected by the youth members appointed by the Governor, including:
three high school students; and
one student at an institution of postsecondary education; and
four members selected by the youth members chosen by other youth, including:
three high school students; and
one student at an institution of postsecondary education.

section.section: The term of a youth member of the Council is 1 year, from September 1 through August 30 of the following year.
A youth member who is appointed or selected after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed or selected and qualifies.
A youth member may not serve more than two consecutive terms.
The member from the Senate and the member from the House serve, respectively, at the pleasure of the President of the Senate and the Speaker of the House.
At the first meeting of each youth member term period, the youth members shall elect one of the youth members to serve as cochair for a term of 1 year.

A representative of the Governor's Office for Children appointed by the Governor, the member from the Senate, and the member from the House shall serve as cochairs with the elected youth member cochair.
The Council may appoint any officers that it considers necessary.

The cochair appointed by the Governor shall, on behalf of the Governor, the President of the Senate, and the Speaker of the House, develop an initial application and application process, both of which the Council may change at its discretion.

text.section: The Governor's Office for Children, in addition to the member from the Senate, or the member from the House, or both, shall provide staff support for the Council.

section.section: The Council shall work with the State Department of Education regarding the granting of school credit for Council service.

The State Department of Education and the Maryland Higher Education Commission shall notify the head administrators of all State high schools and of all institutions of postsecondary education, respectively, of the creation of the Council so that the administrators may inform their students.

The State Department of Education shall allow up to four absences of a youth member from school per school year to be categorized as lawful absences if the absences were due to the business of the Council.
The Council shall review and consider whether the procedures and rules used by the General Assembly would be appropriate for use as models for the Council.

text.section:
The Council shall:
meet at least four times each year and conduct one or two public hearings each year on issues of importance to youth;
conduct one educational meeting concerning the legislative process, to which the President of the Senate, the Speaker of the House, and the Executive Director of the Department of Legislative Services, or their designees, shall be invited to speak; and
open all meetings to the public.

A member of the Council:
may not receive compensation as a member of the Council; but
is entitled to reimbursement for expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations, as provided in the State budget.
On or before the last day of the youth members' terms, the Council shall report its activities to the Governor and, in accordance with § 2-1246 of this article, to the General Assembly.
